com.intel.ispplib.connection.device.service

Class BleIasService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • com.intel.ispplib.connection.device.service.BleIasService

  • public class BleIasService
extends Service
    Service managing one (and soon many)BleIasConnection(s). It allows for many clients to bind to this service and call its methods. It sends callbacks through broadcast intents. The service gives the possibility to execute simple Bluetooth low energy requests but also open and use ispp communication pipes. For Ble requests, remember to consider the gatt status: any status that is not IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS.GATT_SUCCESS is suspicious and you can consider the request as failed, even if it gives some results.

    • Method Detail

      • onBind

        public IBinder onBind(Intent intent)

      • onUnbind

        public boolean onUnbind(Intent intent)

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize()
        Initializes the service. Should be called by a client right after it has bound to the service.
        Returns:
        false If initialization was not successful. False if not. If initialization fails, the service is unusable and this also means that the ble feature is not supported on this android platform.

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String address,
              boolean autoConnect)
        Method for establishing a BLE connection with the specified device The new connection status is sent as a broadcast intent with action ACTION_STATUS_CHANGED, with extra status EXTRA_CONNECTION_STATUS IBleConnection.CONNECTION_STATUS . The gatt status is given also as an extra EXTRA_STATUS IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS A connection is considered successful only if the gattStatus value is GATT_SUCCESS Prior to the connection, the device with the specified address should be discovered using ble scan (see public boolean startLeScan of android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter).
        Parameters:
        address - The bd address of the device
        autoConnect - The autoconnect flag specifies whether the BLE stack always tries to connect to the device. If set to true, The BLE stack will connect to device as soon as it becomes available. If set to false it will attempt a one shot connection.
        Returns:
        true if the connection request was successfully submitted, false if not. If a connection with the specified device has already been established, this method will return false and the connection not executed. As the first version of the service supports only one device, if a pairing with a device exists, the connect method can only be called with the same device's address.

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
        Method for disconnecting from a previously connected device. The new connection status is sent as a broadcast intent with action ACTION_STATUS_CHANGED, with extra status EXTRA_CONNECTION_STATUS IBleConnection.CONNECTION_STATUS . The gatt status is given also as an extra EXTRA_STATUS IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS
        Returns:
        true if the connection request was successfully submitted, false if not. If a previous connection was not established, this method will return false and the disconnection not executed.

      • startIsppConnection

        public boolean startIsppConnection()
        Method for starting an ispp connection. Ispp (Intel Serial Port Protocol) is for creating a virtual pipe over a ble connection. When an ispp connection is opened, both connection ends can send and receive messages. The messages content should fit inside the protocol mtu (maximum bytes that can be sent in one isppWrite (...) call). Before establishing ispp connection, the user has to bind to this service, connect to a device and discover its services. The connection will be established only if the ISPP service is among the discovered services. The new ispp connection status is sent as a broadcast intent with action ACTION_ISPP_CONNECTION_ESTABLISHED, with extra int parameter, EXTRA_MTU, representing the mtu.
        Returns:
        true if the request was emitted successfully, false if not

      • isConnectedToDevice

        public boolean isConnectedToDevice(java.lang.String address)
        Method indicating whether an active BLE connection is currently established with the specified device.
        Parameters:
        address - The device bd address
        Returns:
        true if there is an active connection, false if not.

      • isPairedToDevice

        public boolean isPairedToDevice(java.lang.String address)
        Method indicating whether a pairing with the specified device has been established.
        Parameters:
        address - The device bd address
        Returns:
        true if a pairing with the device has been successfully established.

      • getIsppMtu

        public int getIsppMtu()
        Method for getting the ispp mtu (max payload that can be sent in one ispp message)
        Returns:
        The length of the byte array that can be given as parameter of isppWrite(...) call. If no ispp connection is established, this method will return -1.

      • isIsppConnected

        public boolean isIsppConnected()
        Method indicating whether an active ispp connection is currently established.
        Returns:
        true whether an ispp connection is currently active, false if not.

      • isppWrite

        public boolean isppWrite(int writeId,
                byte[] data)
        Method for writing an ispp message. To be able to send an ispp message, an ispp connection should first be successfully established. The data length should fit in the ispp mtu. The user can provide the writeId parameter, uniquely identifying the write command. When the full data is transmitted by the ispp protocol on the other end, a broadcast intent is sent with action ACTION_ISPP_PACKET_SENT, and extra write identifier : EXTRA_WRITE_ID.
        Parameters:
        writeId -
        data - The data to write
        Returns:
        true if the request to write the message was successfully submitted, false if not

      • isppWrite

        public boolean isppWrite(byte[] data)
        Method for writing an ispp message. To be able to send an ispp message, an ispp connection should first be successfully established. The data length should fit in the ispp mtu.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to write
        Returns:
        true if the request to write the message was successfully submitted, false if not

      • pair

        public boolean pair(java.lang.String address)
        Start the pairing process with the specified device. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_BOND_STATE_CHANGED intents to be notified about the bonding process. The pairing status will be added as an extra (EXTRA_BOND_STATUS), as .icsf.connection.device.DeviceBleConnection.BOND_STATEs
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the device to pair to. As the first version of the service supports only one device, if a connection with a device exists, the pair method can only be called with the same device's address.
        Returns:
        true if the pair request has been successfully submitted, false if not

      • unpair

        public boolean unpair(java.lang.String address)
        Unpair from an already paired device. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_BOND_STATE_CHANGED intents to be notified about the bonding process. The pairing status will be added as an extra (EXTRA_BOND_STATUS), as .icsf.connection.device.DeviceBleConnection.BOND_STATEs
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the device to unpair from.
        Returns:
        true if the unpair request has been successfully submitted, false if not

      • writeCharacteristic

        public boolean writeCharacteristic(java.util.UUID service,
                          java.util.UUID characteristic,
                          byte[] value)
        Method for writing a value to a BLE characteristic. Before being able to write to a characteristic, a connection must be established and services must be discovered. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_CHARACTERISTIC_WRITE intents to be notified about the write status. Extras will contain: -The service UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_SERVICE_UUID) -The characteristic UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_UUID) -The characteristic value ((EXTRA_CHAR_VALUE)) -The gatt status (EXTRA_STATUS as a IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS)
        Parameters:
        service - The unique identifier of the BLE service
        characteristic - The unique identifier of the BLE characteristic
        value - The value to write
        Returns:
        true if the write request has been successfully emitted, false if not If the specified service is not among the discovered services, the write request will not be sent and the method will return false.

      • writeCharacteristic

        public boolean writeCharacteristic(java.util.UUID service,
                          java.util.UUID characteristic,
                          byte[] value,
                          boolean noResponse)
        Method for writing a value to a BLE characteristic. Before being able to write to a characteristic, a connection must be established and services must be discovered. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_CHARACTERISTIC_WRITE intents to be notified about the write status. Extras will contain: -The service UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_SERVICE_UUID) -The characteristic UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_UUID) -The characteristic value ((EXTRA_CHAR_VALUE)) -The gatt status (EXTRA_STATUS as a IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS)
        Parameters:
        service - The unique identifier of the BLE service
        characteristic - The unique identifier of the BLE characteristic
        value - The value to write
        noResponse - Flag that specifies the write type to execute: true means no response write false means acknowledged write.
        Returns:
        true if the write request has been successfully emitted, false if not If the specified service is not among the discovered services, the write request will not be sent and the method will return false.

      • readCharacteristic

        public boolean readCharacteristic(java.util.UUID service,
                         java.util.UUID characteristic)
        Method for reading the value of a BLE characteristic. Before being able to read a characteristic value, a connection must be established and services must be discovered. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_CHARACTERISTIC_READ intents to be notified about the write status. Extras will contain: -The service UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_SERVICE_UUID) -The characteristic UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_UUID) -The characteristic value ((EXTRA_CHAR_VALUE)) -The gatt status (EXTRA_STATUS as a IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS) Remember to consider the gatt status: any status that is not com.intel.icsf.connection.device. IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS.GATT_SUCCESS is suspicious.
        Parameters:
        service - The unique identifier of the BLE service
        characteristic - The unique identifier of the BLE characteristic
        Returns:
        true if the read request has been successfully emitted, false if not * If the specified service is not among the discovered services, the read request will not be sent and the method will return false.

      • discoverServices

        public boolean discoverServices()
        Method for discovering BLE services of an active connection. Before being able to discover the services, a successful BLE connection has to be established. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_SERVICES_DISCOVERED intents to get the discovered services list. The services UUID list can be retrieved using the EXTRA_SERVICES extra. The gatt status is provided using (EXTRA_STATUS as a IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS)
        Returns:
        true if the discover services request was successfully emitted, false if not

      • subscribeToCharacteristic

        public boolean subscribeToCharacteristic(java.util.UUID service,
                                java.util.UUID characteristic,
                                boolean enabled)
        Method for subscribing to a BLE characteristic. Before being able to subscribe to a characteristic, a successful connection must be established and services must be discovered. This is an asynchronous call. Register for ACTION_ON_CHARACTERISTIC_CHANGED intents to be notified about the write status. Extras will contain: The service UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_SERVICE_UUID) -The characteristic UUID (EXTRA_CHAR_UUID) -The characteristic value ((EXTRA_CHAR_VALUE)) -The gatt status (EXTRA_STATUS as a IBleConnection.GATT_STATUS)
        Parameters:
        service - The unique identifier of the BLE service
        characteristic - The unique identifier of the BLE characteristic
        enabled - Flag indicating whether subscription should be enabled (true is enabled, false if not)
        Returns:
        true if the subscribe request was successfully emitted, false if not If the specified service is not among the discovered services, the subscribe request will not be sent and the method will return false.

      • getServices

        public java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getServices()
        Method returning the discovered services. This method can be called after establishing a successful connection and discovering the services (discoverServices(...))
        Returns:
        The UUID list of discovered services if services were discovered, null if not

      • characTeristicExists

        public boolean characTeristicExists(java.util.UUID service,
                           java.util.UUID characteristic)
        Check that the specified BLE characteristic was discovered among services A BLE connection must be established and services should be discovered.
        Parameters:
        service - The service unique identifier
        characteristic - The characteristic unique identifier
        Returns:
        true is the characteristic was discovered, false if not
